title_sort: bethuel smith to walt whitman, 17 september 1863
title: Bethuel Smith to Walt Whitman, 17 September 1863
text: CarlisleSept the 17 63Dear friend walt[Walt]I received your kind letter & was verry[very] glad to hear from you & to hear that you was well I left the armory hospittal[hospital] in somewhat of A hurry I went in the ambulance to the depot & took the Cars north at 11 oclock & we got to philadelphia[Philadelphia] about 2 oclock there we got some bread & ham & coffee we stayed there till three & then we started to harrisburg[Harrisburg] we got there about dark & stayed there all night the next day we started for Carlisle we got to Carlisle about 10 in the morning we went in to hospittal[hospital] tents we have rather poor accomodating[accommodating] her[e] the foot is getting better fast I can get around quite smart on it. I think in A few days I Can put on my boots & not hurt me much of anny[any]Â  there is lots of fruits here & Cakes pies &c. but it dont[don't] do me much good for I have not got any money to buy it with I wish that you would send me A few of them ten cents noats[notes] if you pleas it is verry[very] loansome[lonesome] here to meI hope that I shall soon gow[go] to my regiment for I dont[don't] like to stay here verry[very] well I would like to see you verry[very] wellwell walt[Walt] I dont[don't] now as I have anny[any] more to write at present so good by for this time write soon please Bethuel Smith to Walt Whitman, 17 September 1863
